fields.name: Homepage introduction
fields.content:
The White House and New York University’s Information Law Institute, with support from Google Open Research and Microsoft Research, will host a major public symposium to address the near-term impacts of AI technologies across social and economic systems.

The focus will be the challenges of the next 5-10 years, specifically addressing five themes: social inequality, labor, financial markets, healthcare, and ethics. Leaders from industry, academia, and civil society will share ideas for technical design, research and policy directions.
fields._content_rendered:
The White House and New York University’s Information Law Institute, with support from Google Open Research and Microsoft Research, will host a major public symposium to address the near-term impacts of AI technologies across social and economic systems.

The focus will be the challenges of the next 5-10 years, specifically addressing five themes: social inequality, labor, financial markets, healthcare, and ethics. Leaders from industry, academia, and civil society will share ideas for technical design, research and policy directions.

fields.name: Homepage tickets
fields.content:
Admission is free, but tickets will be required.

Please check back soon for more information, including an opportunity to reserve your ticket.
fields._content_rendered:
Admission is free, but tickets will be required.

Please check back soon for more information, including an opportunity to reserve your ticket.

fields.name: Workshop venue introduction
fields.content: We’ll be meeting at the Grand Hall of New York University’s Kimmel Center. Use the dedicated entrance at 238 Thompson Street. Please bring ID.
fields._content_rendered: We’ll be meeting at the Grand Hall of New York University’s Kimmel Center. Use the dedicated entrance at 238 Thompson Street. Please bring ID.

fields.name: Workshop introduction
fields.content:
We are delighted to invite you to a workshop of leaders and thinkers for “AI Now: The Social and Economic Implications of Artificial Intelligence Technologies in the Near-Term”.  Experts and researchers from across industry, civil society, academia and the White House will gather for a frank and productive day of discussion focusing on the challenges posed by artificial intelligence technologies in the next 5-10 years.

Conversation will focus specifically on four key themes: social inequality, ethics, labor, and healthcare.

The event aims to amplify the voices of those with significant insight and experience across the four areas, with the goal of building new bridges across different communities. Together, we will consider the potential benefits and challenges of AI technologies, and analyze how to ensure AI is built for equality of opportunity.

Following the workshop, attendees will be invited as honored guests to a major public symposium addressing these topics, co-hosted by The White House and New York University’s Information Law Institute.

We think your work is important to this emerging set of debates, and we want to add your voice and perspective. Explore further details on the site, and send along any questions you might have.

Conversation will focus specifically on four key themes: social inequality, ethics, labor, and healthcare.

The event aims to amplify the voices of those with significant insight and experience across the four areas, with the goal of building new bridges across different communities. Together, we will consider the potential benefits and challenges of AI technologies, and analyze how to ensure AI is built for equality of opportunity.

Following the workshop, attendees will be invited as honored guests to a major public symposium addressing these topics, co-hosted by The White House and New York University’s Information Law Institute.

We think your work is important to this emerging set of debates, and we want to add your voice and perspective. Explore further details on the site, and send along any questions you might have.

fields.content: Schedule subject to change.  We'll confirm the schedule closer to the day of the workshop.

fields.content: Schedule subject to change.  We'll confirm the schedule closer to the day of the conference. The event will be live-streamed.
